headline: Show HN: Ielts Speaking Blog: Specialised speech exercises that get results
description:
Hello HN!

I’m a career language instructor —17 years!— that has used shadowing exercises (i.e. teacher says, students repeat) throughout my career to train for pronunciation success. About a year ago, I decided to build a product around this to help students prepare for their IELTS (a language proficiency exam used for university admittance and immigration purposes). So far, the product has attracted lots of signups and positive feedback, which I find reassuring.

I’m very interested to get valuable HN feedback, particular on the UX of my project. I have never been good at UK design, and I worry my presentation here is confusing to navigate. This is a Podia-based project, so I’m trying to wrap my presentation around Podia’s powerful but somewhat rigid framework.

What do you think? Link: https://www.ieltsspeakingblog.com/

(I’m aware you can’t see what a paid account holder would see, but is navigating the landing/free content intuitive?)

Greatly appreciate your time and feedback!
headline_zh-Hans: Show HN: Ielts口语博客。有效果的专业演讲练习
headline_zh-Hant: Show HN: Ielts口語博客。有效果的專業演講練習
description_zh-Hans:
你好，HN！

我是一名职业语言教师--17年！--在我的职业生涯中一直使用影子练习（即老师说，学生重复）来训练发音的成功。大约一年前，我决定围绕这个建立一个产品，帮助学生准备雅思考试（用于大学录取和移民的语言能力考试）。到目前为止，该产品已经吸引了大量的注册和积极的反馈，这让我感到很欣慰。

我很想得到宝贵的HN反馈，特别是关于我项目的用户体验。我一直不擅长英国的设计，我担心我在这里的介绍会让人感到困惑。这是一个基于Podia的项目，所以我试图用Podia强大但有点僵硬的框架来包装我的演示。

你怎么看？链接：https://www.ieltsspeakingblog.com/

（我知道你不能看到付费账户持有人看到的东西，但导航登陆/免费内容是否直观？）

非常感谢您的时间和反馈！
